incidents.name: Lookup Line-Type-Intelligence Errors

incident_updates.body: Twilio Lookup API was degraded between 4:34 AM and 8:35 AM Pacific Time on 08/24/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced 5005 errors on line-type-intelligence queries. The issue has now been resolved.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Line Type queries when using our Lookup API. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Malformed Multi-Segment Incoming SMS Messages Not Logged

incident_updates.body:
Due to an internal error that occurred from 12:28 PST 8/18 through 12:58 PST 8/23, malformed incoming multi-segment SMS messages were not logged. These messages are normally logged with Twilio error 30009:

- https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/errors/30009

The issue has now been resolved, and malformed incoming messages are now being logged.

Our engineers are currently investigating the customer impact of a retroactive issue that affected logging of incoming messages. Note this is specific to incomplete multi-segment messages, which are typically logged with Twilio error 30009. We will follow up and provide customer impact details within 2 hours.

We have identified an issue with the way report usage billing for Programmable Wireless. The team is working to identify the root cause and to resolve the issue. We will provide an update in 1 hour or as soon as more information is available.

incidents.name: WhatsApp Registration and Template Status Issues

incident_updates.body: All WhatsApp template statuses are up-to-date. Sending WhatsApp messages using a template is operating normally at this time.

Some WhatsApp template statuses may be outdated. As a result, sending WhatsApp messages using a template with an outdated status may fail until the status is updated. Any new template status updates are correctly being captured. Our engineering team has identified the cause for outdated statuses and is working on a fix to ensure all template statuses are up-to-date. Previously incorrect WhatsApp template categories have been synced and are now accurate. Any onboarding issues for new WhatsApp senders have been mitigated. There is also no impact to receiving WhatsApp messages. We will provide an update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Some WhatsApp template statuses may be outdated. As a result, sending WhatsApp messages using a template with an outdated status may fail until the status is updated. Any new template status updates are correctly being captured. Our engineering team has identified the cause for outdated statuses and is working on a fix to ensure all template statuses are up-to-date. Previously incorrect WhatsApp template categories have been synced and are now accurate. Any onboarding issues for new WhatsApp senders have been mitigated. There is also no impact to receiving WhatsApp messages. We will provide an update in 24 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Some WhatsApp templates may have an incorrect category or the template status may temporarily be outdated. As a result, sending WhatsApp messages using a template with an outdated status may fail until the status is updated. Any new template status updates are correctly being captured. Our engineering team has identified the cause for outdated statuses and is working on a fix to ensure all template statuses are up-to-date.

incidents.name: Super SIM Connection Event Delays

incident_updates.body: Delays in Super SIM Connection Events has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

Our engineering team has put in a fix to address the issue that is causing delays in Super SIM Connection Events. We will continue to monitor. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

The issue causing delays in Super SIM Connection Events has been identified. The team deployed new service instances to mitigate the impact and devices reconnecting after 18:58 UTC will not encounter delays. Existing connections are being transferred to the newly deployed instances. We will provide another update in 2 hours or sooner once more information becomes available.

Since 12:00 PM UTC we started investigating an issue where users Super SIM may experience delayed in getting their Super SIM Connection Events. Device connectivity to the mobile networks is not impacted.  We are actively working to identify and resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 1 hour or sooner once more information becomes available.

Our monitoring systems have detected a potential issue with Super SIM Connection Events. Our engineering team has been alerted and is actively investigating. We will update as soon as we have more information.

incidents.name: Customers Remaining Suspended After Making Payments

incident_updates.body: The issue with Pay-As-You-Go customers seeing their accounts remaining in a suspended status after making a successful payment has been resolved.
The issue with Pay-As-You-Go customers seeing their accounts remaining in a suspended status after making a successful payment has been fixed. We'll provide another update in 30 minutes.

We have detected an issue where Pay-As-You-Go customers are seeing their accounts remain in a suspended status after making a successful payment. Our Engineers are actively investigating this issue. In the meantime, we ask that customers experiencing this issue sign out and sign back in to refresh their credentials, and if their account is still suspended and it’s been more than 20 minutes since the payment was made, submit a support ticket. We expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.
